intro: Achyrocline saturejoides var. crassiuscula, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, which are pollinated by insects. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and have a somewhat aromatic scent. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that turns red when mature.
